content:
While Loops are commonly used in programming to execute a block of code while a condition remains true. You can generally use a `for loop` to perform the same operations as a `while loop`. 

`While loops`, however, allow you to repeat a block of code without specifying the same constraints in the `for loop` syntax. A `while loop` only includes the `testExpression` part of the `for loop` syntax.

- a `while loop` evaluates the `testExpression` inside the parentheses 
- if that expression is true, the body of the loop will be executed
- the body will be executed until, the `testExpression` evaluates to false
name: While Loops
